fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5640].
  {panel}

A customer has requested the ability to rate pages.

Although there is a rating plugin, this allows one to rate anything i.e. you could have multiple ratings on a single page. What we need though is the ability to just rate the page itself - a page rating.

With a specific page rating we want the ability to not just rate the page but to be able to browse by rating or be able to embed a list of pages sorted by rating, or display a specific list of pages according to their specific rating (i.e. all pages rated 4).

1 - 5 seems still like an appropriate scale. The current plugin rating should be reviewed when implementing this.
fields.summary: Add ability to rate pages
Hide comments completely from certain users (add a hide comments permission?)

fields.description: I have a page containing nothing more than {userlister:online=true} so that I can see who's online at a glance. This worked fine with our Confluence 2.1.3 + JIRA 3.5 deployment using external user management in JIRA for Confluence and with JIRA hooked up to LDAP auth. When I upgraded the systems to 2.1.4 and 3.5.1, respectively, the macro stopped working. If I remove online=true it successfully lists all users (but incorrectly lists everyone as offline).
fields.summary: Userlister for online users broken when using JIRA user management
Notation guide needs updating with new styles for user links and broken links
Streamline comment style so that each comment takes up less vertical height

fields.description:
It would be great if Confluence supported more forum like discussion capabilities, i.e. very thin subject lines for each thread topic that then link through to the full thread - like traditional forums.

It would be ideal if comments could be turned into forums at a page level as a page option and it would also be great if discussions could be held either in place of comments or under a seperate tab (if discussions were turned on for the page). Customers have requested both alternatives during discussions.
fields.summary: Enable forum like, two-level threaded discussions in place of or in addition to comments
Preserve Parent and Space information on Historical Versions of pages

fields.description:
Currently if you give a group edit permissions they will not automatically have the view permission. This makes no sense at all, given that any one who can edit something can not only view it, they can edit it.

We need to fix this.

We need to make sure that any group or individual given the edit page permission is automatically given the view page permission as well.
fields.summary: Page level edit permissions should automatically assume the inclusion of the view permission

fields.description:
In my atlassian-plugin.xml I have something like the following:

<component name="Auto Export Manager" class="it.could.confluence.autoexport.AutoExportListener" key="autoExportManager" alias="autoExport">
  <description>A manager for all configuration aspects of the Auto Export plugin.</description>
</component> 

Upon first installation, each successful "uninstall" -> "reinstall" (I use it a lot while developing), Confluence throws an IllegalStateException saying "Can not overwrite an existing bean definition: autoExport"
fields.summary: IllegalStateException: Can not overwrite an existing bean definition

fields.description:
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
javax.mail.NoSuchProviderException: smtp
at javax.mail.Session.getService(Session.java:611)
at javax.mail.Session.getTransport(Session.java:541)
at javax.mail.Session.getTransport(Session.java:484)

To fix, we need to remove activation.jar and mail.jar from common/lib
fields.summary: SMTP is broken in the stand-alone config

fields.description:
Added two labels to a space via Space Admin tab > Edit Space Labels
Labels are not displayed on the Advanced tab
fields.summary: Advanced page is not displaying Space Labels

fields.description:
I'd like Confluence to allow me to upload multiple versions of the same attachment and access the history. This not only makes it easy to find the latest version of the appropriate file, but also allows a user to see the history of changes to that file (date/time and user).

This feature is present in most other Wiki software and would be extremely useful to have in Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow for attachment versioning

fields.description: Possibly contrary to the idea of a wiki, I would like to suggest storing page content natively as properly nested XML.  I think this would help eliminate some of the rendering and inconsistency errors I have seen with the Rich Text editor, could facilitate complex order and unordered lists, would allow the documents to be rendered in any number of formats (including several different types of wikitext), XML, html, rich text, etc with the use of XSLT.  This could help with PDF generation as well as allow users to easily export pages, spaces, etc.  A logical extension to this would be support of XML Schema for templating purposes.
fields.summary: Natively Store page content in properly nested XML

fields.description: You ship a back level version of the chart macro with Confluence.  The latest release (V 1.5 currently) fixes a bug (http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CHRT-21) and therefore the bundled macro should also include this fix.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Include latest release of chart macro

fields.description:
Apparently the DefaultExportContext has changed signature between version 2.1 and 2.1.4.

The JavaDoc says that it has a void constructor (no parameters):

http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/docs/api/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/importexport/DefaultExportContext.html

While in the classes shipped w/ 2.1.4 I can only see a DefaultExportContext(String) constructor...
fields.summary: Update javadoc for 2.1.4
Bundle loading doesn't work in plugins

fields.description:
I have something looking like this in my atlassian-plugin.xml:

<xwork name="Auto Export Administration" key="autoexportAction">
  <description>...</description>

  <package name="autoexport" extends="default" namespace="/autoexport">
    <interceptor-ref name="defaultStack"/>
    <action name="configure" class="it.could.confluence.autoexport.AutoExportAction">
      <result name="success"  type="velocity">/it/could/confluence/autoexport/console.vm</result>
      <result name="exported" type="velocity">/it/could/confluence/autoexport/monitor.vm</result>
    </action>
  </package>
</xwork>

Apparently the stack doesn't get invoked at all, so much that the setters that should be invoked on my action with the request parameters are never invoked (and I have to manually look into ActionContext.getContext().getParameters()).
fields.summary: XWork's stack doesn't seem to be invoked for plugins.
Original page in PageUpdateEvent/PageRemoveEvent lacks of Space definition
Plugin instances not correctly initialized and contextualized by Spring

fields.description:
Confluence has an aim to be good collaboration tool. ToDo List is one of the most common tools for collaboration in teams and it is very usable for individuals too. Improve functionality of dynamic tasklist. There exist several hints in your Jira. I'm suggesting:

- define permissions for adding and deleting tasks and for changing their status
- add creation date, resolution date and optionally due date
- add "in progress" status for task
- ...
fields.summary: Improve dynamic tasklist functionality.

fields.description:
1) add dynamic tasklist
2) add several tasks into tasklist
3) change order of tasks in tasklist by drag-and-drop function
4) refresh page 

changed order of tasks in tasklist is not kept.
fields.summary: Dynamic tasklist does not keep order of tasks.

fields.description:
Add new events for:
- installing and uninstalling plugins
- enabling and disabling plugin modules
fields.summary: Add new plugin events

fields.description:
1) add dynamictasklist to page.
2) add task to this tasklist.
3) change status of this task

Progress bar wont be changed.
fields.summary: Changing status of task in dynamic tasklist in Opera does not update tasklist progress bar.

fields.description:
When creating a page template it would be great if you had the ability to add labels to the template.  A simple text entry field called "Labels" in addition to "Name" and "Description" would be great, but obviously a previous-label-aware entry woudl be better.

When a page is created with the template, it should automatically have the labels attached.  If you don't want the labels there, delete them after.

With the use of the {metadata} set of macros this would add a lot of power to Confluence since the {metadata-report} macro can aggregate metadata for pages with a given label.  You could then create basic forms as templates, and users could then start mass creating forms (using the template) that will be collected without needing to have them know they need to also add a label.
fields.summary: Add default label(s) to template creation

fields.description:
Hi,

I need pageId of my current page in a template. I try any codes in my Layout but I don't find it.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Velocity parameter to give pageId

fields.description: I just tried to search for all pages with the label "faq_jira_dev". Quite a number of the resulting hits sport a leading text of "http://confluence.atlassian.com/images/icons/favicon.png!", followed by the actual text of the page.
fields.summary: Reference to favicon.png in some label search results

fields.description: We should never send an email to a user who doesn't have us confluence permission, and perhaps shouldn't send empty emails.
fields.summary: Users with no groups still receive daily update emails

fields.description:
While we're doing OK on things like AJAX, RSS and support for external APIs, Confluence exhibits a distinct lack of features considered necessary for an application to be 'Web 2.0', including:

# Rounded corners
# Gradient backgrounds
# Big text and oversize form controls
# OS X-like blue swirly progress-bars

I also suggest we rename the product "Conflncr" (Pronounced 'Confluencer')
fields.summary: Make Confluence more Web 2.0
"Double click starts editing" a per-user preference?

fields.description:
When I create a link to a file on the filesystem, I usually copy the address line from the Windows Explorer for instance c:\temp\somefile.pdf. I prepend file:/// to create an URL. Unfortunately, Confluence deletes the single backslash when displaying the link. It leaves file:///c:tempsomefile.pdf which doesn't work.

I do not want to replace \ with \\ or / for every external file or directory I want to link to. It should work without any special treatment.

Proposal: Add a "local file" link type to the Add Link popup. Then Confluence can handle the link and convert it to handle backspaces correctly. Backspaces work fine with all browsers on Windows, so they can be rendered in HTML like they were entered.
fields.summary: Links to Windows filesystem don't work as expected (backslash vs. double backslash vs. forward slash)

fields.description: This significantly slows down the loading of the Edit screen and the user's drafts list when they have a draft for a really long wiki page.
fields.summary: Merge performance is incredibly bad on long pages

fields.description:
When I first went to edit a page in Confluence 2.x, I clicked the edit label button first, because it says 'EDIT' in all-caps with a yellow background. Of course, this didn't do anything bad, so I could start searching again for the real edit page link.

My girlfriend did the same thing when I asked her to edit a page, clicking on the edit labels link first.

I think this shows that the UI could be improved. When I think, 'I want to edit this page', the most obvious link that says 'Edit' should be the edit page link.

This probably also applies to the yellow backgrounds on the edit page screen. They stand out much more than the save and cancel buttons that are more fundamental to the use of the page.
fields.summary: Edit label button selected by new users when they want to edit page
Export news (blog posts) to PDF

fields.description: A servlet plugin will load fine the first time, but will not unload/reload when the plugin is uninstalled/reinstalled. In fact, it doesn't seem to unload, uninstall, or even disable at all. If you disable the servlet, it still keeps running. If you uninstall the plugin, the servlet keeps running. If you disable it, then uninstall the plugin, the servlet keeps running. It just will not die...
fields.summary: Servlet plugins do not disable or uninstall

fields.description: In history of empty page displayed strange negative number
fields.summary: Wrong changes number in the screen of comparison of versions

fields.description:
While advanced forum functionality is best served by integrating with Jive, it would be possible to adapt Confluence to provide light-weight forum functionality by being able to designate a space as being a forum. In a forum space, pages become threads, with the page being the thread's first post, and all subsequent posts being comments.

# Provide a forum-like theme for displaying pages and comments. Comments will need to be paged.
# Allow the editing of comments - CONF-830
# Default to creator-only page-level edit permissions
# Provide a way to navigate through threads chronologically
# Provide a system label to mark threads as "sticky"
# "notify me automatically on pages I've contributed to"
# Last modified date of a page becomes the latest of the page's last modified date, and those of all its comments.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 27/07/2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Thank you for all your feedback on this issue. After careful thought and analysis, we wish to advise that we will not be implementing any form of forum functionality in Confluence. Strategically, we don't see this as core to the collaborative wiki experience and believe there are other core features we must focus on.

Adaptavist does have the [Community Bubbles Plugin|https://www.adaptavist.com/display/bubbles/forums] for Confluence, which provides basic forum functionality for free. We encourage customers who are looking for this type of functionality to try the plugin, or alternatively, reach out to [one of our partners|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APW/Partner+Wiki+Home] for assistance with custom plugin development.
{panel}
fields.summary: Basic forum functionality

fields.description: We need some means to be able to collaborate on a news entry until we dicide to make it public. Currently, this can be acheived for pages by restricting it from anonymous access until the team is heappy with it. This is not possible for News.
fields.summary: Allow restrictions on News pages
Breadcrumb expansion does not work on left-nav theme

fields.description:
When Confluence is setup against LDAP, a large "confluence-users" causes the "Manage Users" administration page to hang.

I'm hoping to let all of our users use Confluence initially (at least the public parts) and then have space administrators assign specific space privileges. To do that, I have a group in LDAP with all Faculty & Staff users in it (currently 1883 users).

If I take all the users out of the group, the "Manage Users" administration page comes up quickly. If I add the users back into the group, the page hangs forever. I also tested with about 200 users and the page came up quickly as well (showing all users hung but I could search for individual users).

Note: I can run an LDAP query on the group using ldapsearch and get a response back in 3-5 seconds.

If you'd like any further test data, I'd be happy to try specific test cases.
fields.summary: Speed with large LDAP Groups

fields.description:
I have RSS feeds set up for new pages, updated pages, and new comments. For the first 2, it works correctly, but for new comments, the title is always "Comment Added for :Home" (where is the name of the space), even though the comment was added to some other page (not Home) within that space. I have seen this consistently, i.e., *all* RSS items for added comments say Home instead of the actual page name. Interestingly, the link is correct, so when I click on the link for these items it takes me to the correct comment on the correct page (where the comment was actually added). Here's the source of the RSS item:
 Feed: Foo - Comments
 Title: Comment Added for FOO:Home

Page contents.
fields.summary: RSS items have incorrect title for added comments

fields.description:
We often create pages that have images (that are often screenshots).  Being able to directly attach them instead of needing to save them and then attach them would be great.  This would be especially for news posts since we often create a post, then attach an image and then edit the post to include a reference to the image.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 16th September, 2011|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello Everyone,
Thanks for your feedback on this issue. The Confluence team is proud to announce that we will have this feature implemented in the upcoming Confluence 4.0 (due out in a few weeks).

Please note that this feature has been implemented for Chrome and FireFox. Unfortunately, we could not implement this in Internet Explorer due to IE not having the appropriate support for the Clipboard API. We do intend on implementing this for IE once this is complete. You can track that issue here: CONF-23235 

Please note: Confluence does have [existing drag-drop functionality|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Drag-and-Drop] which will allow you to easily drag-and-drop images into the editor (which works for Internet Explorer 8. Note: It does [not work in IE9 due to similar limitations|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Drag+and+drop+does+not+work+in+Internet+Explorer+9+%28IE9%29]).

{panel}
fields.summary: Allow users to paste image in WYSIWYG editor

Then use the new link to create a new page and enter some WIki Markup and hit save. No reaction. If the view is changed to Rich Text then the save button works.

I have tried this on 2.1.3 and 2.1.4.

fields.description: At present, the renderContent method produces HTML (4.0 transitional) that is almost parseable by an XML parser. It would be much simpler if things were taken that extra step and we could request an xhtml format (eg. similar to how parameters can be sent through). The primary problem that we've noticed so far is that element don't have end tags (as per the HTML 4.0 Transitional specification). Cleaning up the renderContent output is possible using JTidy, however that introduces other problems. We could probably also clean up the content using a regular expression targeting elements. tags are in the same boat. There's undoubtedly more, but we're just noting them as they break things.
fields.summary: Add a render option to the remote api renderContent method to emit xhtml rather than html

fields.description:
As an administrator of the wiki, from time to time I need to send Email to all wiki users, or to users of specific groups, or even to users with specific permissions (like to all users who have permissions to admin a space, meaning they are space admins).

This is a standard feature you can see in forums software and obviously should be also in wikis including confluence.

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to erase old page in confluence.

1. It should be possible to go to a specific page and erase versions starting from a specific version
2. It should be possible to erase in all space/wiki old versions of pages that were edited earlier than a given point in time.
fields.summary: Purge historical versions of pages

fields.description:
Currently there is no way in confluence to purge old versions of attachments.

1. It should be possible to erase old versions of attachments and not only the whole attachment including its history. This is to reserve space
2. It should be possible to ask for a report of attachments, sorted by size with their versions and ask to delete versions older than a specific time.
3. It should be possible to ask, per space or even per wiki, to erase old versions of attachments old than spefic time.
fields.summary: Easily purge historical attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5572].
  {panel}

Confluence stores history of pages and attachments already. To see a specific old page or an attachment  you need to go to a specific page.

It would be extremely useful if it was possible to:
1. Define a point in time and walk the space as it was on that time in the psat, including all deleted pages, and older version of pages and attachments, etc. Similar to source control system capabilities. 
This is very useful when you use confluence for software project development, because if I want to see a documentation of an old version then of a software I can't. Once changes made I am in troubles.

2. Give a label to a point in time (let's call it a view) and do #1 based on the label.

3. Allow seeing under a specific space the set of "views" that are available based on labels defined in #2.

Bottom line - take a look at source control systems and bring features from there. The more you bring the better. 

That would be an awsome capability.
fields.summary: Ability to work with a historical version of a space - source control like functionality

fields.description:
Did you ever think about adopting the DITA topic-based authoring approach on top of the current authoring concepts (see : http://dita.xml.org/topic-based-authoring)
This could bring to Confluence a real added value in terms of extensibility and content publishing facilities.
fields.summary: Extensibility through DITA adoption

fields.description:
1. Create a page which includes a link to email in confluence.

 [$1234]

2. You can see the title of linked email in view mode.

3. But when edting the page email link is broken.

 Email link is replaced as [title of linked email] not [$1234] in edit mode.
fields.summary: Email link is broken when editing a page.

fields.description:
{noformat}
Using the rich text editor to insert an image in a page, the first image inserted looks fine in the editor, but when you save, the displayed page shows the wiki tag rather than the image. Editing the page again shows that the RTE has added

 \!imagename.png\! 

in the wiki markup. This happens for both png and jpg files.

Adding a subsequent image using the RTE works properly. The problem can be worked around by editing the wiki markup directly.

FYI, Confluence version is 2.1.4 Build#410 with an evaluation license key.

Apologies if this is a dupe - I searched and couldn't find any similar issues.
{noformat}
fields.summary: First image inserted with Rich Text Editor actually inserts wiki tag as text

fields.description: Need a bug classification of 'Normal'. There is too great a distinction between 'Major' and 'Minor'. This results in every normal bug being classified as Major and the 'Major' classification being devalued as a whole.
fields.summary: Need a bug priority classification of 'Normal'

fields.description:
User management of confluence MUST be improved. It is extremely limited and difficult to work with. Several improvements needed:
1. It should be possible to let specific people (not admins) to manage specific groups - add/remove users.
2. It should be possible to add users to a group when displaying a group and not only add groups to a user
3. The navigation, filtering, etc. of the list of users is very difficult and inconsistent.
4. It should be possible to delete users even if they added content. They could remain hiding underneath for the content to be related to them but even this should be optional, and any way as an admin I shouldn't need to manage them.
5. It should be possible to diasble a user from the user display
6. A user should be able to rename his user name.
7. It would be great if I could consolidate users. Like in the case when a user signed in, edited content, and then changed his login and added more content. Then I'd like to combine the two users into a single one. (that's a bonus after all previous elements will be implemented)
fields.summary: User management MUST improve!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5566].
  {panel}

Confluence sends daily notifications which is a GREAT and very important feature of the product. This is what actually push the knowlege to users.

In an environment of many spaces and active wiki the amount of information is large and only some of the spaces are of interest to a user.

The user should be able to customize the list of spaces for which he receives notification.

It could be in addition to the current daily notifications. So when you don't have time you delete the full and read only the personal while when you have time you go over the full.

The personal one could be based on the spaces the user selected as interesting (this is a feature already exists in Confluence 2.1.x).
fields.summary: Personalized daily notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5565].
  {panel}

Confluence 2.1.x has nice labeling capabilities.

However the search capabilities of those labels are quite poor and inconvinient using labelText:<label>.

For Confluence to server as a strong knowledge base all is needed it the ability to search based on labels (in the context of a space):
1. use label:label1,label2,label3 in the search string
2. GUI that will allow selecting (using checkbox) from the list of all labels.
fields.summary: Enhance Label Search and allow Confluence to server as a strong Knowledge Base

fields.description:
There is no way to define the colour for the breadcrumb navigation in a theme plugin. You can define that colour via the administration UI (system/space) under "Look and Feel" but it seems to be the only colour that can not be defined using a colour-scheme <colour> definition within a theme's atlassian-plugin.xml. Maybe there is a translation entry missing in com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.ColourSchemeModuleDescriptor.

The new colour key has to be documented too in two places:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Theme+Plugins
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+theme+plugin
fields.summary: breadcrumb colour-key in theme colour-scheme missing

fields.description:
Currently when someone changes its user profile, and when there are spaces available that anonymous users can use, those anonymous users can see the user profiles changes in the list of recently changed pages. They are able to view each user profile.

Sometimes this is good, but sometimes the user profiles contain information that should not be visible on the internet. 
I think it is a privacy issue, because when visible for anonymous it also means it will become googleable. User should be aware of this.

I really would like this to be configurable, so that we can turn this behaviour off. May be each user should declare himself that it is allowed to publish the user profile to anonymous users.

We were confronted with this issue when opening up one space to the anonymous world.
fields.summary: Option to prevent anonymous users (incl google) to view user profile details (changes)

fields.description:
LDAP provider allows to operate on profile only in the ReadOnly mode. But at the same time there are no instructions on the Confluence settings for the correct parameters displaying from LDAP (e.g.: the user Email).
I consider that the best way is to store (edit) the following attributes in LDAP: 
1) email - the attribute is used by the different applications interacting with LDAP, as a result it is advisable to store this attribute only in LDAP (and not duplicate it to the Confluence base)  
2) FullName - it is desirable to use the FullName parameter instead of the combination of the Name and LastName fields when displaying the user name. The user name should be presented in the native language (but it is not always English and a name may include more than two words). 
3) For Jira, it is desirable to use the language parameter not from the inner base but from LDAP so as it may be set up not from the administrator panel. 
All the other attributes are stored and edited in the application base.
fields.summary: The facility to operate on the LDAP profile (based on AtlassianUser ) not only in the ReadOnly mode

fields.description: Is it possible to use the groups defined in LDAP and the inner groups concurrently? The supposed function of inner groups is creating the temporary groups uniting LDAP users (not from client LDAP, but from administrator panel). How to organize the inner groups uniting LDAP users?
fields.summary: Concurrent use of inner groups and group based on LDAP (based on AtlassianUser)

Though, the user authentication in LDAP is successful. LDAP connection settings are attached. Could you clarify the problem of interaction with groups - invalid settings or provider error?

fields.summary: Problems with Confluence 2.1.4 and DB2 8.1.2

fields.description:
This tasklist doesn't work becouse of the dot (.) in the name:
{dynamictasklist:Name with a dot.}
fields.summary: Dynamictasklist doesn't work with a dot in the name

fields.description:
Copying text from Acrobat 7 and pasting into a text editor or Microsoft Word results in a whole lot of boxes. No content.

Possibly a consequence of the Verdana font used in the PDF, although you would think pasting into a text editor wouldn't care about the font.

Perhaps an encoding issue, then?
fields.summary: Can't copy text from exported PDF

fields.description: Breadcrumbs in wrong order or breadcrumbs display out of order after restoring or importing a backup.
fields.summary: Breadcrumbs in wrong order

fields.description:
The export zip file created when calling the exportSpace() remote API method with 'TYPE_XML' is different to doing a full XML export from the web UI.

Perhaps the options used to generate the export remotely are different to those used by the web action. This should be fixed so that they are the same.
fields.summary: Space export created by remote API is different to that created using web UI
Google sitemaps support

fields.description: A problem with the Johnson filter?
fields.summary: Going to login.action when confluence is not set up does not redirect to setup

fields.description: Occurs even when appending ?os_username=foo&os_password=bar.
fields.summary: Access denied on URL returned by remote API exportSpace()

fields.description:
The page assigned as navigation page for the Left Navigation Theme does not render in the "Left Navigation" area under any of the following conditions:
- After logging out from Confluence
- When current page is a profile page

This bug makes it realy hard for us to carry on with confluence evaluation at Volvo.
fields.summary: Navigation page of Left Navigation Theme does not always render

fields.description:
Navigation page does not render (wiki mark-up is displayed) under any of the following conditions:
- After logging out from Confluence
- When viewing a profile page
fields.summary: Navigation page of Left Navigation Theme does not always render
